CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is a former employer of the open joint - stock company “ PERSON ( “ the company ” ) situated in the town of GPE , the GPE region . The ORG have not held any share in the company since DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the company to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL in salary arrears . This judgment was enforced in full on an unspecified date in DATE .

CARDINAL . While the enforcement proceedings in respect of the above judgment were still pending , the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG and the company claiming compensation for pecuniary damage caused to him due to the non - enforcement of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE in due time .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered that the company pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL in compensation for inflation losses . By the same judgment , the court rejected the applicant ’s claims against ORG as unsubstantiated . This judgment became final and the enforcement writ was transferred to ORG for enforcement .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the enforcement proceedings on the ground that the company had been declared bankrupt by the decision of ORG of DATE .
CARDINAL . The judgment of DATE remains unenforced .

CARDINAL . In DATE , while the enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of DATE were still pending , the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG seeking compensation for the latter ’s failure to act .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court found in part for the applicant and ordered ORG to pay him UAH CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage caused as result of the non - enforcement of the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the enforcement proceedings in view of their own lack of funds .
CARDINAL . The judgment of CARDINAL DATE remains unenforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
